website_summaries.verdict: Classic chisel design from a well-known manufacturer. Extra-long blade is ideal for woodworking.
pros: Chisel blades consist of a top-quality high-carbon chrome steel that will last
4 different chisel widths included, ranging from 0.25" to 1"
Blades are thinner and longer than average, which works well for precise woodworking needs
Handles are a great shape with a sturdy wood design
cons: Higher price than some other chisel sets
Not as durable as older Stanley chisel sets

customer_reviews.title: Chinese Quality @ Western Prices? :(
customer_reviews.text: Machine marks all over the mystery metal “made from global materials.” Black & Decker is genius for trying to assemble cheap materials and market to the classic Stanley made in USA quality name. They aren’t bad, but save your money and buy Narex or something actually priced at the cheap material price that these really are... if you want quality, buy Lie Nielson. If you want cheap, buy Narex. Don’t buy this unhappy medium overpriced marketing nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: An excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: The Stanley 750 Sweetheart is generally considered to be one of the finest chisels made. Whilst not quite on par with Lie Nielsen or Veritas, with a bit of work it most definitely can be the equal of any chisel on the market...for less than half the price! This particular blend of British steel falls sonewhere vetween O1 and O2 steel in its properties and some feel it is the best choice available for an artisan chisel. Definitely holds an edge longer than O1 whilst being easier to sharpen and more corrosion resistant than O2. A great buy for a set of lifetime tools that will be passed down to your great grandchildren!
customer_reviews.author: Edmund Sergeant

customer_reviews.title: I really like these chisels
customer_reviews.text: For every size that I have used, they were sharp out of the box. I have stropped them after use and they seem as good or better than they were. It is pretty common for the handles to separate from the chisels in the bundle but they are brand new and I expect that I have to give them a good wack with the mallet to seat them. Way better dovetail experience than using the cheapo contractor big-box 10 dollar chisel set. These are at least square, let alone sharp. I am happy with the purchase overall. Worth the money I spent and no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and don’t worry about the handles
customer_reviews.text: They feel and work as good as they look! If you are an amateur then don’t be alarmed if the handle comes off. It is part of the socket handle design of all higher end chisels. Some people have epoxied them in but I wouldn’t recommend that. Scuff up the handle’s cone end (that inserts into the chisel and whack the handle back into the chisel a few times and it’s in. Doesn’t guarantee to stay but certainly more snug than initial use. The steel is perfect as it sharpens nicely but holds its edge nicely too so you can certainly pare with it, to an extent, and not struggle after a few whacks between paring.
customer_reviews.author: Perseus

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of reasonably priced chisels
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for home not wanting to spend the money on a Lie-Nielsen set (designed after Stanley Sweetheart 750 series) which is always in the shop. After close inspection - the edges were very sharp, no burrs, chips, or defects. Really nice leather roll. A little tuning (minor flattening and micro bevels) and they will be near as nice as the Lie-Nielsen except for one thing. The long edges of the bevel are inconsistent (ranging from a strong 1/16" to 3/16") on each of the chisels. Not a deal breaker, but potentially an issue for dovetail work.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Chisels are a win, leather case is a fail.
customer_reviews.text: Good steel. Good blades. Leather storage wrap is badly designed, chisels fall out and the leather tie design is pretty dumb. If you're just after the chisels, go ahead and get this. If you care about the case at all, look for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Aeschylus

customer_reviews.title: Not your grandfather's vintage 750s
customer_reviews.text: Over all disappointed. These are not your Grandfather's 750s that were make from O1 tool steel. Nor are they Lie-Nielsen's (A2 tool steel) which were an improved version of the original. Backs were mostly flat. Side bevels don't bevel close enough to the backs for dovetailing. One handle appears to have a check which will split as some time. The wood handled Buck Bros may prove to be a better buy for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Wergeld10

customer_reviews.title: These speak for themselves
customer_reviews.text: These Stanley Sweetheart chisels name alone speaks for itself. Excellent Sheffield steel. All chisels, regardless of brand should be sharpened when you get the before using, factory sharpening and transport don't make them as sharp as they should be. Once sharpened they go through even hardwood like soft butter. Great set, and a very good price for this particular set.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great set for a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: Work as they should. Lighter weight than I expected but, they are easy to sharpen and maintain their edge well. Bevel and sides are within 1/32" of parallel/square. For those that complain about the chisel separating from the handle, read up on how to use/maintain socket chisels. Separating the handle is good for sharpening and makes replacements easy. To secure sand the wood portion of the socket lightly with an abrasive 220 or lower to improve the friction fit. They will loosen between seasons just tap them to seat.
customer_reviews.author: BEN

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: The biggest pro to the set was all of the backs were hollowed. Flattening only took somewhere from 1.5 hours to 2 hours for every chisel in the set to mirror finish. I was looking to get the WoodRiver socket chisel set, but they cost more for only 4, and my last experience with WR chisels the backs were bellied, and each chisel took 5 hours of machining.
customer_reviews.author: nic field

customer_reviews.title: A bargain
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value set of tools. Yes - Plan on some elbow grease and time at your sharpending station setting them up. I got mine tuned up and turned out a couple of sample dovetails and a sample tenon in some hardwood. I’m very pleased. I can see that with care, these tools will last a lifetime. If you’re looking for a quality tool at a great price, this is it. Just be prepared to set them up properly by honing the backs flat and setting the primary bevel up the way you want.
customer_reviews.author: fly guy

customer_reviews.title: Solid set of lifetime chisels
customer_reviews.text: I got these for myself as a birthday gift and referred to one of Paul Sellers videos to sharpen them. Even out of the box it's good to hand sharpen them to get them in peak shape. They've been solid so far, although the handles are friction fit so at first they came off; a light sanding and smacking them back on does the trick. Great carrying case too!
customer_reviews.author: Mth44

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Stanley Chisel Set
customer_reviews.text: This STANLEY Sweetheart Chisels Set has been a dream come true. They are beautiful right out of the box and they are exactly as I expected them to be. The Beech-wood handles are beautifully crafted and are easy to hold and the overall craftsmanship of the chisels is excellent. The leather tool roll is also a nice addition to this set and it is nicer than expected. I haven't used them yet so I can't comment on their performance.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN ENGLAND!
customer_reviews.text: I spent months researching what chisels to get, looked at Lie Nielson, Narex, vintage on ebay, etc. I chose the sweetheart set because (A) they are made in England, NOT China, and (B) they are styled after the vintage Stanley 750 series- a highly regarded classic chisel that sells for top dollar on ebay. When the chisels arrived, they were perfect and ready to use. I sharpened them after hollowing out some pieces of oak for boxes and sharpened them after with diamond stones. These hold their edge and shatpen relatively easily- extremely happy with this set and would 100% reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: CHIP DOUGLAS

customer_reviews.title: A great value set
customer_reviews.text: These are great chisels for the price. They take a keen edge and keep it relatively well. I do wish the handles were just a tad bit bigger, but most socket chisels are smallish anyways (i have xl hands). They work great for hammering on and do a fairly decent job of fine paring.
customer_reviews.author: Jordicus

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful chisels. Be aware that they aren't as convenient ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful chisels. Be aware that they aren't as convenient as cheap chisels. On these, the handles fall off unless you really hammer them in with a mallet. They do arrive sharp, but I wouldnt shave my balls with them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not Imperial and Not Metric
customer_reviews.text: Only one chisel in the bunch measured to it's stated width. Backs were fairly flat and overall appearance quality is good. Don't count on accurate Imperial or metric widths. Closer to metric than to Imperial as stated in the listing. You will be disappointed if your looking for true imperial chisels. Remember too that this is a socket chisel, never pick it up by the handle.
customer_reviews.author: rr64

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Woodworkers!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this for her 24-year-old boyfriend who does woodworking and such. He was very surprised to get these (just in time for Valentine's Day) and loves working with these. Says they are just what he needs to do his projects, and are a good value product for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthe H

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding chisels. I have wanted a set old school chisels for a long time. I only needed the set of 4, but pulled the trigger on the set of 8 with the leather pouch. I have not used them for anything critical yet, but they sharpen up nicely. I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Joh775

customer_reviews.title: Nice chisels
customer_reviews.text: I have not had the opportunity to use these chisels yet or put an edge on them. I do not foresee any problems. I have nothing to complain about. I doubt that they equal the original sweetheart chisels but I likely would not notice.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas E. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good Chisels
customer_reviews.text: The one inch chisel took a long time to lap the back. The other 3 did not take as long. The handles have to be fixed into place by tapping them on with a mallet. Once on, they are pretty fixed on. Before sharpening, you will want to take off the protective coating with lacquer thinner, or it will gum up your sharpening stones. All they need is a quick stroke on a fine stone, they hold their edge pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Moonara

customer_reviews.title: A little prep and ready to go!
customer_reviews.text: Chisels arrived on time. I popped off the handles and soaked the blades in lacquer thinner to remove protective coating. Then I polished the blade back and faces with a diamond hone. I finished the hone with a Norton 8000 grit waterstone. Finally I scuffed the handle tangs with 220 grit sandpaper and reassembled them. This is the normal kind of preparation you would expect in a new cutting tool. Cutting surfaces took a mirror finish and handles are tight! Exactly what I wanted in a set of chisels. THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: Russ M.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Choice for an i mid-level chisel.
customer_reviews.text: These arrived with a very sharp edge. I have merely flattened the backs which took awhile not because they were wrapped or or had inclusions but because the steel is quite hard. The length, balance, shape of the handles all provide amazing control. They are a joy to use. Would highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Guy

customer_reviews.title: Sweetheart alternative if LN is not in your budget!
customer_reviews.text: Being the owner of full set of LN bevel edge chisels, I am very pleased with my purchase of this set. Great quality that is budget friendly. Although not finely polished as LN I expect with a little tuning these will do quite nicely. Each chisel is machined to +-.010 of the given width. Leather tool roll is a very nice plus. Chisel set arrived well protected and just as described. Stanley has done a great job with these Sweethearts!
customer_reviews.author: cadman9604

customer_reviews.title: Best seen from a distance lol
customer_reviews.text: I got this on a pretty decent sale price. They seem to work just fine but the fit and finish is pretty bad. The chamfers along the sides of the chisels don’t align and are at alternating widths. I think as a starter set of chisels it’s a good buy if you can get them at a good price. If your a serious woodworker spend you money on something better, it gets A LOT better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Best chisels I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Best chisels I've owned. Very close out of the box. Had to spend maybe 15 minutes on each one to take them all the way to mirror polish. Very sharp, hold edge extremely well and the length is awesome. Handles feel perfect and the weight is spot on. You feel like an artist with these in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: adam scott

customer_reviews.title: Good chisels. Great balance for intricate working
customer_reviews.text: Good chisels. Great balance for intricate working. Very easy to tune. The machining was great and the backs had a slight hollow for easy flattening and polishing. I re-beveled on grinder to 25 degrees and micro-beveled to 30 on stones. Honing was very easy, but I did have to remove the lacquer coating so it didn't gum up my stones. Stanley coats the blade to prevent corrosion, but I think it's highly unnecessary. Not a big deal...as mentioned before a 5 minute soak in lacquer thinner and scotchbrite made quick work of it. Leather holder is very nice!
customer_reviews.author: avrojockey

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Love these chisels! Replaced some cheap Stanley chisels with this set. Very noticeable upgrade in quality and hold an edge much longer than the Stanley’s. Love the feel of the hornwood handles. I used the included leather pouch to hang them in my modest wood shop, and am very pleased with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Garvoille

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: Ready to go right out of the box. Could probably be sharpened a little more but was still good enough to clean up end grain and some plywood The handle is really comfortable in the hand and is slim enough to get into tight angles. Haven’t used em too much yet. Will do an update later
customer_reviews.author: Michael Arki

customer_reviews.title: They just feel wonderful in my hand.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first set of good chisels but compared to the others these are in a different world. nice and sharp out of the box but I'm going to do some flattening and sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod D Boden

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of the chisel. They have a similar look to the insanely expensive lie nielsen chisels with a much smaller investment. The tools sharpen up great. I use a veritas honing guide and various norton sharpening stones. Other than that, I really like the handle. It's small enough to grab and pear away some wood but it's also balanced enough to give it some light tapping with a mallet. They arrive with the handle NOT set into the steel. I ended up setting mine incorrectly. I believe it should be a force fit but I removed too much material and now have to glue them in place.
customer_reviews.author: eyesonlybob

customer_reviews.title: High Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent basic set of wood chisels - arrived promptly - as advertised - love using them and leather case provides great protection (preserving sharpe edges) and keeps them all together for quick access - highly recommend these chisels!
customer_reviews.author: Tmp3

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck with western chisels (in my opinion)
customer_reviews.text: Overall pretty well machined. I still sharpened and flattened the backs but that was mostly to remove machine marks. The fact the the Lie Nielsen chisels are modeled after the original 750’s prove this classic design is still functional.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter set...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Bought this set listed as “used” but they were in perfect condition, plastic wrappers weren’t even opened. The box looked like it was from the 70’s but the chisels and leather roll are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: B Tennyson

customer_reviews.title: Good chisels, fair price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, pretty good chisels for what you pay. Only one required extensive work to get it ready. The 3/4” had a slight twist along it’s length that took about 15 minutes to flatten out on diamond plates. Other than that, they all took a good edge and hold it better than most.
customer_reviews.author: chad norman

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Chisels
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened the package, I was impressed by the way the chisels felt and looked. They were machined and ready for use. The leather pouch is awesome and looks nice on my workbench. I spent the whole day yesterday using them on joinery for a floor cabinet, and I was very happy with how they performed. I have no doubt that these will be go-to chisels for a long long time. I appreciate the affordability, but these chisels do not look or perform cheap. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: T Oviatt

customer_reviews.title: Holds a nice edge
customer_reviews.text: I tuned these chisels up the moment I opened the box. Once you get the spray coat off it goes really fast. Online I have read mixed reviews on the flatness of the backs, I had only one that took longer then 10 minutes and it was the largest size. It was concave so it would have been fine, but I like the mirror finish so I kept going. I have yet to sharpen them again and have gotten a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Semper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool for the money. If you're stepping up from big box chisels, these are good chisels before throwing serious change at high dollar English and Japanese chisels. I've been chopping compound dovetails in quarter-sawn oak (1 full inch thick) with excellent results. They're not too hard (or brittle) to sharpen regularly or too soft to hold their edge. Also, I happen to use a soft-face dead-blow hammer with these. Do not use steel faced hammers with these handles.
customer_reviews.author: Ed &Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Sharp right out of the box - can’t comment on durability yet as I’ve only had them for a short while. Leaps and bounds higher quality than my big box store chisels. Make sure you store properly as they are “socket type” chisels so the metal can fall out of the handle if left hanging by the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp, fine quality
customer_reviews.text: These chisels are perfect. Craftsmanship is superb. Price is very good, for such excellent quality. I assumed I'd need to put a fine edge on each before using, but nope... Right out of the box, the chisels pared fine hardwood shavings. Stanley's Sweetheart line is a nice alternative to L-N, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Joe VTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Better than entry level
customer_reviews.text: It took much work to flatten the backs of the larger (1" and 3/4") chisels. The 1" chisel has a major grinding flaw near the socket, but not worth returning, since I only needed to flatten the first inch or so to get a good polish. These stay sharp longer than my Irwin chisels, but no where near as long as my Veritas chisels, but the price was right for the set. Once flattened and honed, they are a pleasure to use. These chisels are well balanced easy to hold with just the fingers.I can't compare them to L.N. since I don't own any. Great chisels for a serious hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: T. Carstensen

customer_reviews.title: Good tools
customer_reviews.text: These chisels came useable out of the box in a nice leather roll. There were no nicks on the cutting edge. The chisels required honing and fine tuning like most tools and held their edge for a decent amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt d Fro

customer_reviews.title: These chisels are amazing. They are made of really good quality tool ...
customer_reviews.text: These chisels are amazing. They are made of really good quality tool steel and hold an edge very well. Very easy too sharpen which is a huge plus. The cut through wood with no pressure. I love the socket design, great balance and comfort. The only thing I wish is that they would have less milling marks, it takes a little while to get them ground flat . But you really don't need too if your not that serious about it .
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The backs were so out of flat i could have used one as a ramp to jump over some 40 school busses. The lacquer was slapped on really thick and took some work to get off and the machine finishes were sub standard... but the steel seems to be alright and not complete poop. I think they are worth the $170 for the 8 piece but i would not pay a penny more for them.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: This is my first good chisel set. I've gone to town with these things. They are easy to sharpen, hold their edge reasonably well, and are very comfortable to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Janik

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Product comes in a pretty nice pouch. Some complaints about the handles being loose on the chisel, you just need to read the instructions. The handle fits onto the taper socket of the blade so you just need to hit the handle against a bench a few times for it to be seated nice and snug. Chisels came sharp and ready to use. They didn't have a micro bevel so that will be something you may want to do, but they do come sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Myrna A Baneck

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! For the money! Love these was a gift from my wife and these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, kinda small handles
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful set, well made, really nice tool roll. To be fair though, I was expecting the handles to be a bit larger; when gripping the handle, there’s not much room for a mallet to land before making contact with flesh. Needs honing before use, but that’s expected. I’ll do that in the coming days, and report back with their performance.
customer_reviews.author: Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Did you use socket chisel before?
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made. As sharp as you can expect coming from the factory, and will work as is. Some people will prefer to polish before use. I did not use socket chisels before and to my taste the handle is on a smallish side, I would prefer it somewhat larger. The instructions also advise to fit handle to the socket which I did with abrasive powder.This only took 15-20 min
customer_reviews.author: My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: All mine were straight and required the usual prep for sharpening. They will now shave hair off the arm-
customer_reviews.author: Scott Williams

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Chisels
customer_reviews.text: These are sweet indeed. Small and delicate looking, but very well made and able to take and keep a very sharp edge. I have had no problem with the handle falling off as some reviewers are complaining about. You need to set them correctly, and they will stay in place as well as any other socket type chisel. I have become quite found of these chisels in a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Luc

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, no issues.  A little pre-use sharpening turns this from good to great.
customer_reviews.text: Good for someone getting into woodworking and doesn't want to spend an arm and a leg. They work ok right out of the box but with a little tuning and some sharpening, they've functioned great cutting mortises and various joints in all kinds of hardwood (maple, cherry, walnut, sapele, purpleheart, etc)
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: not as thin in the edges
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting to get a thinner chisel for those tight spaces... but is just regular width... But is as good as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Javier E.

customer_reviews.title: Your future favorite woodworking tool
customer_reviews.text: Really excellent quality chisels in a very nice leather roll. Hold an edge very long and shave off wood face or end grain like a breeze. Visually and ergonomically wonderful too.
customer_reviews.author: Christian S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chisel
customer_reviews.text: Almost as good as the old sweat heart chisels. I needed to touch up the edges to suit me but nice edge right out of box.
customer_reviews.author: TER

customer_reviews.title: Great chisels for beginner or advanced skill
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to go wrong with these chisels. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: cDub

customer_reviews.title: 95 these are nice chisels. They will need the backs flatten and ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price point of $159.95 these are nice chisels. They will need the backs flatten and polished as does the front bevel need work. I believe that any mid range cost chisel needs to have this work done. Once you have sharpen the chisels they are comfortable in the hand and hold an edge under normal use, although they feel a bit light in weight, over time I am sure I will become use to them. They should give a lot of years of good service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mid level chisels
customer_reviews.text: Took some time in the stones to get the backs flat and the edges established but very good chisels for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Truely sweethearts :)
customer_reviews.text: These chisels are really nice and durable. They sure cost, but buy once, cry once, then enjoy forever! They are nicely machined and one cannot compare these to the cheapo throwaway chisels big box stores carry. After removing laquer coating, initial sharpening and polishing, they stay very sharp for very long. Can't be more happy than with this set.
customer_reviews.author: KarstenTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great chisels
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, excellent tools. Those that have trouble with "handles falling off" do not understand concept of socket chisels. Rough up the handle insert with 60 grit paper, slip it in the chisel, grab chisel blade securely (watch out for cutting edge) and rap it hard on a firm bench top. No issues after that. If you want more security put a drop of high quality wood glue and smooth around the handle insert. Would recommend these chisels as a very big bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Joel H. Williams

customer_reviews.title: A high quality lifetime tool
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't go wrong with these chisels. I did flatten the backs and honed them sharper than I received them. I did learn a lesson on making sure to prep the handles for the sockets so they won't fall off and nick the fresh edge I just put on them. The instructions do mention all these points however and they don't distract from the high quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Brown

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful set!
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp, high quality. This product is giftable and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Really are sweethearts
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when these came out. I recommend roughing up the wood a little where the handles fit into the bell like others have suggested. There is some work that needs to be done to get these ready to go, but the value here is worth it--they truly are sweethearts.
customer_reviews.author: L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice chisel set
customer_reviews.text: Good quality chisel set. Quite sharp but I still ran them over a DMT diamond sharpener to polish the bevel and remove the protective laquer.
customer_reviews.author: CatDog

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Perfect for my husband and his hand ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Perfect for my husband and his hand crafting in the garage. He loves doing some of the tougher work by hand and these are great sturdy chisels to do so with.
customer_reviews.author: Leah R.

customer_reviews.title: Steel is not that great. I had to sharpen these more often than ...
customer_reviews.text: Steel is not that great. I had to sharpen these more often than my inexpensive Marples set. It's a shame too, because they are beautiful and feel nice in the hand...but edge retention should be paramount...not looks.
customer_reviews.author: Daz

customer_reviews.title: Nice set.
customer_reviews.text: Picked up this set to add to the butt and HF sets I have. To my surprise, these were right on the money. Sharp, accurate (presharpened to 30 degrees, Considering all the hit and miss reviews, these were spot on. Handles are a bit small, but I'll get used to them. All chisels work when they are sharp. These have consistent edges and should make sharpening easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp out of the box!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wipe it with paint solvent before lapping it on my diamond stone. It only need about ten strokes to make it dead flat. I am not sharpen it. It sharp already out of the box. The balance is ok. Nice chisel. You won't regret buying it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adi Santosa Budiman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: just got mine today and i just finished flattening the backs and put a 25° bevel on them and they cut like butter. the only con i have is they came with a 30° bevel and it took forever to bring it to 25°. the steel is tough though. love them.. also i sanded the butts to 220 grit sandpaper and put a couple coats of boiled linseed oil on them. so glad i bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon James Johnson

customer_reviews.title: great set for the money
customer_reviews.text: great set for the money,sharp enough to use out of the box but they do have a light coating of lacquer on them that has to be honed off.also the handles will fall off if you don't use them with a mallet first. I am a professional woodworker and use them almost on a daily basis in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Winters

customer_reviews.title: Once you flatten the backs, they hold and edge
customer_reviews.text: I like these chisels. They hold an edge longer the the old blue marpels I used for years. They do take a long time to flatten the backs when prepping them for the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what the carpenter ordered!
customer_reviews.text: Love these chisels. Once prepped and honed they cut like a razor...be careful!
customer_reviews.author: M. Cloer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great quality without breaking the bank. It took about two hours to flatten and sharpen.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Chisels
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. Excellent chisels. They hold their edge very well. It was a bit of work to get them flattened but that's mainly because they are pretty hard. After the blades were true, I loved the chisels. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Abraham

customer_reviews.title: These are much lighter and better balanced than the narex set I started with
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for about 6 months. Took very little time to flatten the backs. They hold their edge well and have performed as expected. the handles fit well and are well made. These are much lighter and better balanced than the narex set I started with.
customer_reviews.author: mfc

customer_reviews.title: Quality control could be better
customer_reviews.text: While I’m sure these chisels will probably function fine, I did have a small gripe concerning 1 of the 4 chisels I received. The side bezels on the 1⁄2” chisel is terrible. It seems to mostly correct by the end at the tip of the chisel but back at the handle its almost distractingly bad. I'm just surprised something like that would make it through quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Whitish

customer_reviews.title: Great Chisels.
customer_reviews.text: Not particularly sharp out of the box but 5 minutes on a stone or sandpaper and you’re good to go. Very useful for my woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: Adela

customer_reviews.title: Great chisels, lose the lacquer
customer_reviews.text: Great chisels. I was able to dovetail together two pieces of hard maple and sycamore I had around with them straight out of the box without much trouble at all. Those woods did start to peel off the lacquer coating from the factory, so just do yourself and your sharpening stone a favor and soak them in acetone to remove it. (There is a piece of paper included in the box that mentions the blades are lacquered now.)
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bairstow

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Sweetheart tools are a cut above the normal Stanley quality. Very happy with the chisels! They hold an edge well and are easy to resharpen when needed. Good handle for using with a mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Digelectric

customer_reviews.title: wax coating wears off after a few cuts.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, high quality chisels. These are a pleasure to work with.
customer_reviews.author: thomas Shelder

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good set of chisels but still need some work. Sharpened up quickly but took a lot of work to get the bottom perfectly flat.
customer_reviews.author: funumptygump

customer_reviews.title: Woods best friend.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe not the best chisel out there but a very good set for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Terrific choice for Chisels
customer_reviews.text: These are terrific chisels. High quality and hold an edge well. To keep the handles in the socket, buy a small can of hair spray and spray the part of the handle that fits in the socket. Soak it pretty well, then insert into the socket and hold it there for a few moments, then let it dry. These are great for cleaning out mortises. Holds an edge well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lecoq

customer_reviews.title: great chisels
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality chisels from Stanley. Comfortable handle and good steel. Holds an edge for a good amount of time. Haven't had issues with handles falling out and the backs were reasonably flat with some lapping on a coarse diamond stone they became dead flat. I would recommend these to any woodworker
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Must have these
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sharp right out of the box. I couldn’t ask for more out of these chisels especially for the price. My only regret is waiting so long to get a set.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Shipman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chisels
customer_reviews.text: Love these chisels. Doesn't take much to plane the back flat and put a mirror edge on them. Love the socket-style chisels, and the handles feel great. Love the leather roll case as well to keep them protected.
customer_reviews.author: Krkn

customer_reviews.title: Made to last
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful worksmanship! Husband was a new woodworker at the time I purchased them several years ago and absolutely loves them still.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made chisels and they keep an edge well
customer_reviews.author: David Y

customer_reviews.title: The handles are not as nice as the originals but
customer_reviews.text: Very nearly the same quality as ORIGINAL 750 chisels. The handles are not as nice as the originals but, they are comfortable, durable and very useable. They do come loose and had to be seated using Hair Spray. I love mine. They hold an edge well. Great set!
customer_reviews.author: JWood

customer_reviews.title: Still sharp!
customer_reviews.text: With proper sharpening and honing, I think these are as good as any set of chisels you'll get for the price. Mine have kept an edge for a long time and I use them maybe once a week on average.
customer_reviews.author: Zapato

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely done. Can't speak for the quality of the steel yet but every other aspect looks really good. Be prepared to spend some time getting them into fighting condition. That's normal for this price range. And don't you dare use them for opening paint cans!
customer_reviews.author: Willie D.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality steel stays sharp long time while working with them
customer_reviews.text: Really nice chisels. Stay sharp. Nice leather pouch to keep them in also.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: The replacement set is in good order and has no apparent defects
customer_reviews.text: 1 of the chisels in the first set received had a chip out of the cutting edge. The replacement set is in good order and has no apparent defects.
customer_reviews.author: E's Mumbles

customer_reviews.title: the fit and finish of these is bad, not terrible but most definitely bad
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what all the hype is about, the fit and finish of these is bad, not terrible but most definitely bad! I own a lot of chisels these are by far the worst of them.
customer_reviews.author: Redstopgreengo

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the awesome service.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for the awesome service. Love these chisels. Yes, there are more expensive Chisels and cheaper ones too. But for the money and if you take care of them these are the Bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these chisels.
customer_reviews.text: Love the chisels. I don't have any expensive ones to compare these to, but I have these sharpened to a 15000 grit Sharpton stone and they are fantastic for the price. The leather pouch is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Noshow

customer_reviews.title: Good chisels
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic chisel, holding its edge cuts easily through walnut. The only surprise was the bevel was ground to 30 degrees instead of 25. Overall not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Glaves

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: The backs were mostly flat. Required only about 10 minutes of grind/polish using a diamond plate and shapton stone.
customer_reviews.author: wayne taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: They have performed very well and are so much better than my cheap set from Home Depot. Keeps a good edge and are very well balanced. Got them so sharp that after dumb mistake I needed to get stitches.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My set was nice pretty sharp out of box. Not sure why these other reviews got bad copies
customer_reviews.author: Jon d

product_meta.title: STANLEY Sweetheart Chisels Set, 4-Piece (16-791)
product_meta.description:
Size:4-PieceIntroducing the Sweet Heart 750 Series of socket chisels. Once again, Stanley has reached backwards to move forward and reconnect with woodworkers! Tool steel blades forged in the U.K. with genuine hornbeam handles. Delicate looking, well balanced and every bit genuine hardworking chisels! Individually boxed. Handle require setting prior to use. Set includes 1/4a€, 1/2a€, 3/4a€ and 1a€ with a genuine leather tool roll.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Sweetheart line socket chisels are based on the classic 750 design, which is arguably the best Stanley chisel ever made. Machined from high carbon steel, the Sweetheart chisels sharpen easily and retain a razor-sharp edge over long periods of use. Their side bevels are extra narrow for working in tight corners. This helps the user to avoid inadvertent marring of the work when precise cuts are critical. Designed for striking and paring, the hornbeam handle provides a comfortable feel that transfers energy effectively when struck by a mallet. It also provides a wide butt end, or large sweet spot, for striking accuracy. Manufactured in Sheffield, England. Set includes the following sizes: 1/4", 1/2", 3/4", and 1", chisels and a leather pouch.
feature_bullets: Long blade is ideal for woodworkers
High-carbon chrome steel with tapered bevel sides.16-782 - Sweetheart Chisel 1/4inches,16-785 - Sweetheart Chisel 1/2inches,16-787 - Sweetheart Chisel 3/4inches,16-788 - Sweetheart Chisel 1inches
